visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a chart with the following specifications: Chart type: spline. Chart title: Monthly Average Temperature and Rainfall. Axes and labels styling: X-axis labels should be in a 12px Arial font, Y-axis labels should be in a 14px Verdana font with a dark gray color, and the title for the Y-axis should be in a 16px bold Verdana font. Data series: The first series should be named 'Temperature' with data [7.0, 6.9, 9.5, 14.5, 18.2, 21.5, 25.2, 26.5, 23.3, 18.3, 13.9, 9.6] and the second series should be named 'Rainfall' with data [49.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4]. Custom colors: Temperature series should be in red (#F33) and Rainfall series should be in blue (#08F). Additional configurations: The chart should have a white background, a margin of 50px on all sides, and a legend positioned at the bottom of the chart.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart titled 'Monthly Average Temperature and Rainfall'. The chart includes two y-axes, one for 'Temperature' and another for 'Rainfall', each with distinct styling and colors. The x-axis represents the months of the year with labels styled in Arial font. The y-axis labels and titles are styled in Verdana font with specific colors and sizes. The 'Temperature' series is displayed as a spline with red color, while the 'Rainfall' series is displayed as columns with blue color. The chart has a white background and a margin of 50px on all sides. The legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart, centered horizontally.
